alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 6:06PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following county, San Miguel. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated light to occasionally moderate rain due to persistent showers that are moving north at 10 mph. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inch are expected over the area through 800 PM MDT. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Las Vegas, El Porvenir, Montezuma, Storrie Lake State Park, Romeroville, Gallinas, Mineral Hill, San Geronimo and San Pablo. - This includes the following low water crossings... West Las Vegas High School, Mills Bridge and Valencia Street. This includes the following highways... State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 7...and between Mile Markers 9 and 12...and near Mile Marker 14. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 9. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 1 and 4. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
